To modify existing geometry data without affecting other nodes sharing the same data, substitute `modify_` methods to obtain a unique copy for safe modifications.

Modifying existing geometry data

If you want to load a model and operate on its vertices, you can walk through the vertices as shown in the previous section <reading-existing-geometry-data>, but you should substitute ~.GeomNode.modify_geom(), ~.Geom.modify_vertex_data(), and ~.Geom.modify_primitive() for ~.GeomNode.get_geom(), ~.Geom.get_vertex_data(), and ~.Geom.get_primitive(), respectively. These calls ensure that, in case the data happens to be shared between multiple different GeomNodes, you will get your own unique copy to modify, without inadvertently affecting other nodes.
